Posts.Title: How were you diagnosed? Symptoms/Signs, etc? greenacres nelia48

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2007 06:13PM d23 wrote: I had a clean mammogram, and a clean gynecology exam. A few weeks after the gyn exam, I did a self-exam and found an area of denseness. I have very dense breasts, but this was in the one area I had thought didn't have any denseness in it, so it concerned me. No other symptoms. I made an appt for an ultrasound (hadn't been having them; the doctor had mentioned my needing them at the time), and the radiologist saw it instantly (though she didn't tell me about it; the surgeon the told me the next day). They were so sure that if the biopsy had come back benign, they would have gone in again for another biopsy.
Posts.Title: How were you diagnosed? Symptoms/Signs, etc? greenacres nelia48

Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2007 02:04PM d23 wrote: Come to think of it, around 7 years ago, they had me do an ultrasound after the mammo, and then see a breast surgeon, just to doublecheck, according to my gyn. The breast surgeon thought I was okay, but had me come for follow-ups for a while, then a year or two later, he said I didn't have to come back. Turns out, my surgeon estimates the tumor's been growing 5-7 years. Really made me wonder. I wish I'd been more proactive then, instead of not asking questions and just doing what everyone told me. Never again.
Posts.Title: How were you diagnosed? Symptoms/Signs, etc? greenacres nelia48

Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2007 09:55PM d23 wrote: Hi, Ladies - I just wanted to mention that yesterday was the first anniversary of my first chemotherapy last year.  I'm done with surgery, done with reconstruction, done with everything except tamoxifen, and I feel great.  It feels like forever while you're going through it, but in the end, it'll just be a blip, though a very unpleasant one.  I hope you're all posting notes like this in a year.  You will get through it. All the best, Mindy
